content.description: Perceived Seriousness of Global Warming by Political Ideology
content.question: Beliefs about Global Warming Conservatives Moderates Liberals It is a crisis 7% 15% 29% It is a major problem 24 % 44% 44% It is a problem 15% 19% 12% It is not a problem 49% 20% 13% Source: Republished with permission of Gallup, Inc. from Global Warming or Climate Change: Is There a Difference?, Riley E. Dunlap, 1999; permission conveyed through Copyright Clearance Center, Inc. Which of the following statements are supported by the data in the table?

choices.label: Conservatives are more likely than liberals to believe that global warming is a crisis.
Moderates are more likely than conservatives to agree that global warming is not a problem.
Liberals are more likely than moderates to agree that global warming is a crisis.
Conservatives are more likely than moderates to say that global warming is a major problem.

content.answer: Liberals are more likely than moderates to agree that global warming is a crisis.
